00020 #ifndef _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_
00021 #define _PASSENGER_EXCEPTIONS_H_
00022 
00023 #include <oxt/tracable_exception.hpp>
00024 #include <string>
00025 #include <sstream>
00026 #include <cstring>
00027 
00028 /**
00029  * @defgroup Exceptions Exceptions
00030  */
00031 
00032 namespace Passenger {
00033 
00034 using namespace std;
00035 
00036 /**
00037  * Represents an error returned by a system call or a standard library call.
00038  *
00039  * Use the code() method to find out the value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time
00040  * the error occured.
00041  *
00042  * @ingroup Exceptions
00043  */
00044 class SystemException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00045 private:
00046         string briefMessage;
00047         string systemMessage;
00048         string fullMessage;
00049         int m_code;
00050 public:
00051         /**
00052          * Create a new SystemException.
00053          *
00054          * @param briefMessage A brief message describing the error.
00055          * @param errorCode The error code, i.e. the value of errno right after the error occured.
00056          * @note A system description of the error will be appended to the given message.
00057          *    For example, if <tt>errorCode</tt> is <tt>EBADF</tt>, and <tt>briefMessage</tt>
00058          *    is <em>"Something happened"</em>, then what() will return <em>"Something happened: Bad
00059          *    file descriptor (10)"</em> (if 10 is the number for EBADF).
00060          * @post code() == errorCode
00061          * @post brief() == briefMessage
00062          */
00063         SystemException(const string &briefMessage, int errorCode) {
00064                 stringstream str;
00065                 
00066                 str << strerror(errorCode) << " (" << errorCode << ")";
00067                 systemMessage = str.str();
00068                 
00069                 setBriefMessage(briefMessage);
00070                 m_code = errorCode;
00071         }
00072         
00073         virtual ~SystemException() throw() {}
00074         
00075         virtual const char *what() const throw() {
00076                 return fullMessage.c_str();
00077         }
00078         
00079         void setBriefMessage(const string &message) {
00080                 briefMessage = message;
00081                 fullMessage = briefMessage + ": " + systemMessage;
00082         }
00083         
00084         /**
00085          * The value of <tt>errno</tt> at the time the error occured.
00086          */
00087         int code() const throw() {
00088                 return m_code;
00089         }
00090         
00091         /**
00092          * Returns a brief version of the exception message. This message does
00093          * not include the system error description, and is equivalent to the
00094          * value of the <tt>message</tt> parameter as passed to the constructor.
00095          */
00096         string brief() const throw() {
00097                 return briefMessage;
00098         }
00099         
00100         /**
00101          * Returns the system's error message. This message contains both the
00102          * content of <tt>strerror(errno)</tt> and the errno number itself.
00103          */
00104         string sys() const throw() {
00105                 return systemMessage;
00106         }
00107 };
00108 
00109 /**
00110  * A filesystem error, as returned by the operating system. This may include,
00111  * for example, permission errors.
00112  *
00113  * @ingroup Exceptions
00114  */
00115 class FileSystemException: public SystemException {
00116 private:
00117         string m_filename;
00118 public:
00119         FileSystemException(const string &message, int errorCode,
00120                 const string &filename)
00121                 : SystemException(message, errorCode),
00122                   m_filename(filename) {}
00123         
00124         virtual ~FileSystemException() throw() {}
00125         
00126         /**
00127          * The filename that's associated to the error.
00128          */
00129         string filename() const throw() {
00130                 return m_filename;
00131         }
00132 };
00133 
00134 /**
00135  * Represents an error that occured during an I/O operation.
00136  *
00137  * @ingroup Exceptions
00138  */
00139 class IOException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00140 private:
00141         string msg;
00142 public:
00143         IOException(const string &message): msg(message) {}
00144         virtual ~IOException() throw() {}
00145         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00146 };
00147 
00148 /**
00149  * Thrown when a certain file cannot be found.
00150  */
00151 class FileNotFoundException: public IOException {
00152 public:
00153         FileNotFoundException(const string &message): IOException(message) {}
00154         virtual ~FileNotFoundException() throw() {}
00155 };
00156 
00157 /**
00158  * Thrown when an invalid configuration is given.
00159  */
00160 class ConfigurationException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00161 private:
00162         string msg;
00163 public:
00164         ConfigurationException(const string &message): msg(message) {}
00165         virtual ~ConfigurationException() throw() {}
00166         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00167 };
00168 
00169 /**
00170  * Thrown when SpawnManager or ApplicationPool fails to spawn an application
00171  * instance. The exception may contain an error page, which is a user-friendly
00172  * HTML page with details about the error.
00173  */
00174 class SpawnException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00175 private:
00176         string msg;
00177         bool m_hasErrorPage;
00178         string m_errorPage;
00179 public:
00180         SpawnException(const string &message)
00181                 : msg(message) {
00182                 m_hasErrorPage = false;
00183         }
00184         
00185         SpawnException(const string &message, const string &errorPage)
00186                 : msg(message), m_errorPage(errorPage) {
00187                 m_hasErrorPage = true;
00188         }
00189         
00190         virtual ~SpawnException() throw() {}
00191         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00192         
00193         /**
00194          * Check whether an error page is available.
00195          */
00196         bool hasErrorPage() const {
00197                 return m_hasErrorPage;
00198         }
00199         
00200         /**
00201          * Return the error page content.
00202          *
00203          * @pre hasErrorPage()
00204          */
00205         const string getErrorPage() const {
00206                 return m_errorPage;
00207         }
00208 };
00209 
00210 /**
00211  * A generic runtime exception.
00212  *
00213  * @ingroup Exceptions
00214  */
00215 class RuntimeException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00216 private:
00217         string msg;
00218 public:
00219         RuntimeException(const string &message): msg(message) {}
00220         virtual ~RuntimeException() throw() {}
00221         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00222 };

00224 /**
00225  * The application pool is too busy and cannot fulfill a get() request.
00226  *
00227  * @ingroup Exceptions
00228  */
00229 class BusyException: public oxt::tracable_exception {
00230 private:
00231         string msg;
00232 public:
00233         BusyException(const string &message): msg(message) {}
00234         virtual ~BusyException() throw() {}
00235         virtual const char *what() const throw() { return msg.c_str(); }
00236 };

00238 } // namespace Passenger
